'''Nicola Panaro''' (born in [[Casal di Principe]], September 12, 1968), is an Italian [[Camorra|Camorrista]] and member in the [[Casalesi clan]] from [[Casal di Principe]] in the [[province of Caserta]] between [[Naples]] and [[Salerno]]. He has been on the "[[List of most wanted fugitives in Italy|most wanted list]]" of the Italian ministry of the Interior since 2003 until his arrest in April 2010. Convicted for extortion and membership in the Camorra, he has yet to serve a prison sentence of nine years and four months.<ref name=ricerca>{{it icon}} [http://www.interno.it/mininterno/export/sites/default/it/sezioni/sala_stampa/notizie/polizia/Latitante_panaro_nicola.html Direzione centrale della Polizia Criminale - Programma Speciale di Ricerca - Nicola Panaro]</ref>
He is a nephew of Casalesi boss [[Francesco Schiavone]] and considered to be the actual leader of the clan with Schiavoneâs wife Giuseppina Nappa, [[Vincenzo Schiavone]] and [[Mario Caterino]].<ref name=rai300908>{{it icon}} [http://www.rainews24.it/it/news.php?newsid=86489 100 arresti e 100 milioni sequestrati ai casalesi], Rai News, September 30, 2008</ref> He was first arrested in March 1999 for [[racketeering]] and Mafia association. He was also charged with the murder of Aldo Scalzone in 1991. The Camorra considered Scalzone to be a police informer. Panaro was released in 2002 after his lawyers demonstrated that testimonies of Camorra turncoats were insufficient. Since his release he became a fugitive.<ref name=meo>{{it icon}} [http://simonedimeo.blogspot.com/2009/06/nicola-panaro-superlatitante-casalese.html Nicola Panaro superlatitante casalese], Simone Di Meo blogspot, June 9, 2009</ref><ref name=rep140410/>
His brother Sebastiano Panaro received a life sentence at the [[Spartacus Trial]] against the Casalesi clan. Nicola Panaro is accused of being the intermediary of the clan in financial transactions with [[Nicola Cosentino]], Undersecretary to the Ministry of Economy of Premier [[Silvio Berlusconi|Berlusconi]]âs fourth Government and head of Berlusconi's [[People of Freedom]] (PdL) party in Campania.<ref name=rep031209>{{it icon}} [http://napoli.repubblica.it/dettaglio/cosentino-ancora-accuse-br-cambiava-assegni-ai-clan/1795413 Cosentino, ancora accuse], La Repubblica (Naples edition), December 3, 2009</ref>
On January 8, 2009, an international warrant was issued against him, to be arrested for extradition.<ref name=ricerca/> He was arrested on April 14, 2010, in [[Lusciano]] (Italy).<ref name=rep140410>{{it icon}} [http://www.repubblica.it/cronaca/2010/04/14/news/camorra_arrestato_boss_dei_casalesi-3356915/ Camorra, nuovo colpo ai Casalesi; arrestato il superlatitante Nicola Panaro], La Repubblica, April 14, 2010</ref>
